news.title: Jaipur civic body attaches five properties over UD tax in Murlipura
news.para: Jaipur Municipal Corporation intensified its urban development tax collection drive, attaching five properties in Murlipura zone for non-payment. Property owners promptly cleared dues totaling Rs 8 lakh, benefiting from a government waiver on interest and penalties. Additionally, two marriage halls were sealed for unpaid registration fees.

news.title: Yamuna Expressway authority sets aside 500 acres in sector 11 for AI & finance hub
news.para: Yamuna Expressway Industrial Development Authority (YEIDA) is developing a 500-acre hub in Sector 11 for AI and financial services companies. Land acquisition is largely complete, and YEIDA will now invite expressions of interest from firms. The sector will also house data centers and companies in banking technology and financial software development.

news.title: Goa government set to start land survey five decades after previous one
news.para: Goa is launching its first land survey in over 50 years to update records and issue urban property cards. The digital survey will begin in Panaji, Margao, and Cuncolim municipal areas, following the notification of the Goa (National Geospatial Knowledge Based) Land Survey of Urban Habitations Rules, 2025.

news.title: Nashik civic body collects ₹66 crore in property tax dues in four months
news.para: Nashik Municipal Corporation's amnesty scheme successfully recovered Rs66 crore from property tax defaulters. This initiative saw 86,000 defaulters clear dues, benefiting from significant penalty waivers. The civic body's property tax collection has now reached Rs208 crore. Officials are confident of meeting the annual target despite recent diversions for election duties. A dedicated recovery drive is planned for February and March.

news.title: Mangaluru civic body begins ward-wise survey to improve property tax collection
news.para: Mangaluru City Corporation has initiated a ward-wise property survey to accurately count all existing properties and boost revenue collection. The survey, launched in Attavar ward, aims to provide a complete picture of property numbers across 60 wards. This initiative is expected to clarify the status of approximately 90,000 pending properties, aiding in achieving the revenue target.

news.title: Visakhapatnam: VMRDA to develop 25,000 plots in middle-income group layouts
news.para: Visakhapatnam Metropolitan Region Development Authority (VMRDA) will develop 25,000 plots for middle-income groups in 2026. Ten major goals are set for this year, including master plan completion and road development. VMRDA will also launch 'Work with VMRDA' for direct citizen interaction. Initiatives like VIBE and digitisation will enhance transparency and efficiency.

news.title: Mumbai: Court junks classification of Godrej & Boyce's land in Vikhroli as slum
news.para: The Bombay city civil court has quashed a decades-old government notification classifying Godrej & Boyce's Vikhroli land as a slum. The court declared the notification invalid, preventing state acquisition and restraining authorities from treating the property as a slum area. This ruling protects the private land from state intervention.

news.title: Gujarat to develop five satellite towns to ease pressure on cities by 2030
news.para: By 2030, Gujarat is set to transform its urban landscape with the creation of five satellite towns: Sanand, Savli, Kalol, Bardoli, and Hirasar. Equipped with metro-like transit systems and complemented by electric buses, these towns will alleviate congestion in larger cities.

news.title: Absence of written tenancy agreement does not bar jurisdiction of rent authority: Allahabad HC
news.para: The Allahabad High Court has granted rent authorities the power to handle eviction cases even in the absence of a formal tenancy agreement. This means that landlords are no longer restrained by the need for specific documentation when pursuing eviction.

news.title: Corporate affairs ministry orders probe against Shree Cement, seeks information
news.para: Under the scrutiny of the Ministry of Corporate Affairs, Shree Cement finds itself the subject of an official investigation initiated with a letter from the Ministry's Regional Director on January 1. This examination falls under the purview of Section 210(1)(c) of the Companies Act, 2013.

news.title: House prices in UK dips 0.4% in December 2025
news.para: UK house prices dipped in December, signaling the slowest annual growth since April 2024. Contrary to analyst hopes for a slight increase, the figures have taken a step back. On a brighter note, mortgage approvals are holding steady, and the easing of interest rates is enhancing affordability for buyers.

news.title: Town planning department rescinds settlement zoning proposal at Arambol
news.para: Goa's TCP department has revoked land use conversion approvals for two large plots in Arambol, Pernem, following sustained villager protests. The decision impacts approximately 3 lakh sqm, including orchard land, a playground, and a crematorium, which were slated for settlement zone conversion. This move aligns with the TCP minister's announcement to withdraw the earlier approvals.

news.title: Chronic property tax defaulters to face sealing, auction action in Mohali
news.para: Mohali Municipal Corporation has initiated a strict enforcement drive against chronic property tax defaulters, primarily targeting major commercial and industrial establishments. Sealing notices have been issued, with a final three-day grace period granted for payment before premises are sealed and potentially auctioned to recover dues.

news.title: HC raps MHADA officials for stalling redevelopment of two Pune housing societies
news.para: The Bombay High Court has rebuked MHADA officials for overstepping their authority and jurisdiction by misinterpreting the Chief Minister's remark as a stay on housing redevelopment projects. The court also criticized the local MLA's "extra-legal interference" to pressure officials, upholding the validity of a previously granted NOC and directing a decision on another proposal.

news.title: Six illegal colonies demolished in Ambala Cantonment
news.para: Ambala's District Town Planner demolished six illegal colonies spanning 21.5 acres in Ambala Cantonment. The operation dismantled temporary roads and demolished 27 under-construction structures to curb unauthorized development. Officials urged the public to avoid purchasing property in illegal colonies to prevent financial and legal issues.

news.title: Get fire NOC within 30 days or face action: Ludhiana residents told
news.para: Following a recent major fire, Ludhiana civic body mandates fire safety NOCs for all commercial buildings, educational institutions, and industrial units within 30 days. Non-compliance will result in hefty fines up to Rs 50,000 and potential building sealing. Residents can apply online for assistance.

news.title: Fixed fee for property tax name transfers from January in Tambaram
news.para: Tambaram City Municipal Corporation has significantly reduced property tax name change charges, introducing a uniform fee of ₹500 for residential and ₹1,000 for commercial properties. This move, effective from January, replaces the previous system where charges were based on property market value, often costing residents thousands.

news.title: Mysuru: MDA invites landowners to submit consent letters for proposed mega residential layout
news.para: Mysuru Development Authority is planning a large residential layout on 2,113 acres. Landowners will receive 50% of developed land. Villagers claim they are unaware of the project. Real estate experts question its feasibility, suggesting vertical development instead. The project requires consent from over 1,500 landowners.
